introduction: How the Monuments Came Down is a deep dive into the history of Richmond, Virginia through the lens of the confederate monuments that served as a constant reminder of the white supremacy and Black resistance that shaped the city. Directors Hannah Brown Ayers and Lance Warren speak with activists, descendants, and historians about why the monuments went up and how they came down in this poignant, timely documentary. Introduction by President and CEO of VPM Jayme Swain, discussion with filmmakers Hannah Ayers and Lance Warren and story advisor and descendant Joseph Rogers, moderated by Dr. Andrea Douglas (Jefferson School African American Heritage Center).Produced by Field Studio in association with VPM.Awards and honors:2022 Capital Emmy for Best Historical Documentary |2021 Thaddeus Stevens Award for Social Engagement, Middlebury New Filmmakers Festival
